==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|タツノオトシゴ|海馬 (Seahorse)}}
{{wikipedia|Seahorse}}
[[File:Black_Sea_fauna_Seahorse.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|海馬}} (''umiuma'', ''kaiba''): a '''[[sea horse]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うみ|うま}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=うみうま|海|tr1=umi|t1=ocean, sea|馬|tr2=uma|t2=horse}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|うみうま|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=2|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うみうま}}

# [[sea horse]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|竜落子|たつ の おとしご}}

===Etymology 2===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|セイウチ|海馬 (Walrus)}}
{{wikipedia|Walrus}}
[[File:Noaa-walrus22.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|海馬}} (''kaiba''): a '''[[walrus]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|かい|ば}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かいば}} {{m|zh|海馬|tr=xoj<sup>X</sup> mæ<sup>X</sup>|lit=sea + horse}}. Compare modern {{etyl|nan|-}} reading ''hái-bé''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|かいば|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かいば}}

# [[sea horse]]
# [[walrus]]
# {{lb|ja|anatomy|sort=かいは}} the [[hippocampus]] {{gloss|a part of the [[brain]]}}

=====Usage notes=====
The {{m|en|walrus}} sense is more commonly expressed using the term {{m|ja|海象|tr=seiuchi}}.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|sea horse}} {{ja-r|竜落子|たつ の おとしご}}
* {{sense|walrus}} {{ja-r|海象|せいうち}} {{qualifier|more common}}
* {{sense|hippocampus}} {{ja-r|海馬体|かいばたい}}

===Etymology 3===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|トド|海馬 (Steller sea lion)}}
{{wikipedia|Steller sea lion}}
[[File:Steller_sea_lions_(Eumetopias_jubatus)_on_rocks.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|海馬}} (''todo''): a female and male '''[[Steller sea lion]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=とど}}
From {{etyl|ain|ja|sort=とど}} {{m|ain|トド|tr=todo}} or {{m|ain|トト|tr=toto||sea lion}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|とど|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|胡獱}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|とど|トド}}

# the [[Steller sea lion]], {{taxlink|Eumetopias jubatus|species|noshow=1|ver=161017}}, the largest of the [[sea lion]] species

=====Usage notes=====
{{U:ja:biology|トド}} The kanji spellings are rare. When written in kanji, the {{ja-l|胡獱}} spelling may be more common, likely to avoid confusion with the alternate readings of the {{lang|ja|海馬}} spelling of ''umiuma'' and ''kaiba''.
